property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Afghan locals in a rural settlement

note.text: An estimated 32 million people live in Afghanistan as of 2016. At least 80% of Afghans live within 50 kilometers of the ring road. The remainder are farmers in rural settlements or nomads.
Most nomads are Pashtun herders, although several thousand Kyrgyz and Balochi nomads live in the northeastern part of the country.
